title: How to write a biography of a personality with little access to them or experience - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t. To even begin to do a biography, you have to research, research, research. Not just in books, but by interviewing people. To see a master work in biography, try looking at the series of books on LBJ by Robert A. Caro. Caro is ultra old fashioned: he writes on a typewriter, and instead of recording or taping, he uses shorthand to record his interviews. But his books are breathtaking. Not only do they capture people, they capture, place, and time, and eras and movements.
